title: Darren Till: I deserve UFC's BMF title as much as Nate Diaz or Jorge Masvidal
text:
Till can’t understand why the UFC would create a BMF belt (Picture: Getty)

Darren Till admitted he is not a fan of the ‘baddest motherf*****’ belt on the line at UFC 244’s main event.

Nate Diaz and Jorge Masvidal will fight for an actual UFC title, with Till the co-main event in his clash with Kelvin Gastelum.

Till is moving up to middleweight, accepting a fight with a dangerous opponent and believes he and Gastelum are just as deserving of the belt as Masvidal and Diaz.

‘I don’t like it too much,’ Till told to Metro.co.uk when asked what he thought of the belt.

‘It doesn’t mean anything really. I’m a bad motherf*****.

Advertisement

‘I’m jumping up weight, I should be getting that belt.

‘The UFC belt is the belt you want. No disrespect to Masvidal or Nate and you do have to consider the fact they are bad motherf******, but so am I and so is Gastelum.’

While Till doesn’t have much time for the BMF title, he does think freshly crowned middleweight champion Israel Adesanya is fully deserving of his belt.

Adesanya became champion earlier this month thanks to a stunning performance against Robert Whittaker in Australia and Till was blown away by the New Zealander’s display.

‘I think he’s the whole package,’ Till said.

The UFC decided to create a belt for Diaz vs Masvidal (Picture: Getty)

‘Me and him are very alike. He’s got swag, style and he knows how to talk. He’s very intelligent, he can fight and he’s cool.

‘What’s not to like? The only people hating on him are jealous, bitter people.’

‘I thought he could lose that fight and he just beat Rob up,’ Till continued. ‘I don’t see where any hatred could come from.

Till thinks Adesanya is a worthy middleweight champion (Picture: Getty)

‘Rob Whittaker fought Yoel Romero twice and beat him twice. Maybe the second one he didn’t.

‘Still, Israel comes in and beats him like that, shows what a fighter he is. The whole package.’
